channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Nurses Union wants safety assurances after concerns about millions of masks
item.description: The Nurses Union says it wants assurances from the Ministry of Health that hospital workers are safe after it pulled millions of masks over quality concerns.

item.title: Aurora Energy's network changes only a start, mayor says
item.description: Changes to Aurora Energy's $380 million network upgrade don't go far enough, Central Otago's Mayor says.

item.title: Principal condemns 'all lives matter' comment after BLM poster removed
item.description: A staff member was wrong to remove Black Lives Matter posters put up by students, Christchurch Girls' High School's principal says.

item.title: Hamilton statue's removal raises debate over artefacts of British colonialism
item.description: Some Waikato Māori say glorifying colonial-era figures with statues is a daily reminder of the devastating effects of British imperialism and its ongoing impacts.

item.title: Collaborative 'Food Factory' produce space opens in Nelson
item.description: The Nelson Food Factory, inspired by trustee Pic Picot of Pic's Peanut Butter World, is operated as a charitable trust and is designed as a collaborative working space for various businesses.

item.title: Rotorua housing shortage: Council and iwi strategy touts thousands of new homes
item.description: Thousands of new homes could be built in Rotorua as a result of a proposed new strategy for housing in the city.

item.title: Ōtāhuhu community fights plans to stall town upgrade
item.description: A South Auckland business association is fighting council plans to delay the final stages of its town centre upgrade as part of budget cutbacks due to Covid-19.

item.title: Rangitoto channel dredging: Move to reject submissions 'extraordinarily undemocratic'
item.description: Iwi and environmentalists opposed to a proposal to dredge the Rangitoto shipping channel are outraged Auckland Council wants to reject half of the submissions against it.

item.title: Mt Hutt skifield draws record crowd for 2020 opening day
item.description: A sizeable crowd was already waiting before the skifield opened, including Ben Yorston, who was first in line for the eighth year in a row.

item.title: Police find body in search for missing Northland woman
item.description: Northland woman Bridget Simmonds was last seen in Whangārei in February last year when her mother dropped her off at a Countdown supermarket.

item.title: Man sentenced to 15 years for Greymouth murder
item.description: The man who murdered Greymouth woman Barbara Quinn last year has been sentenced to 15 years in prison.

item.title: Aurora Energy upgrade will now cost $383 million
item.description: Aurora Energy has cut its proposed network upgrade spending in response to Covid-19, only retaining spending that it says is "absolutely necessary".

item.title: Covid-19: Quality concerns over 4.9m masks in New Zealand - Ministry of Health
item.description: The Ministry of Health has identified concerns with the quality of 4.9 million masks purchased internationally as part of New Zealand's response to Covid-19.

item.title: New support hub for foreigners in Queenstown inundated
item.description: More than 400 migrant workers and employers have already been helped by Queentown's new information centre, set up to help those stranded by Covid-19.

item.title: Why Lumsden is hot right now - a local's love for his town
item.description: Lumsden has been a recurring early morning warm spot in RNZ's daily weather watch. Lumsden Hotel owner Tim Hanna says the tiny Southland town's climate is special.

item.title: Covid-19: No new cases in New Zealand for 21st day
item.description: New Zealand has now marked 21 days since its last new case of Covid-19, the Ministry of Health has confirmed.

item.title: Police seize $1.5 million cash in organised crime operation
item.description: Police have seized vehicles and more than $1.5 million in cash after search warrants were executed in Bay of Plenty, Waikato and Auckland yesterday.

item.title: 2020 ski season kicks off as first field opens for the winter
item.description: The ski season kicks off from today as Canterbury's Mt Hutt welcomes people back to the slopes under the new normal.
